challenges.title: Introduction to CSS
description: You will now be learning CSS, the language for styling the web.
CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a language used to format and style HTML.
CSS like most all programming languages is case-sensitive

challenges.title: Documentation for CSS
description: You will need documentation for CSS.

The best documentation for CSS is found on the Mozilla Developer Network (MDN).
You can add the word MDN to any search to find the document on the MDN.

Try it out. Use this search on Google:

background-color mdn

The official specification for CSS is found at the W3C website.
These docs have all the information about CSS but are generally harder to read than the MDN.

Checkout the W3C website by searching for:
w3c css

challenges.title: ** Read CSS The Definitive Guide 1 through 20
description:
It is recommended that you read the chapters 1 through 20 of the book:

CSS The Definitive Guide

by Eric Meyer

You may find a free pdf or html version of the book online.

You can search Google for a pdf version of the book by including the words 'pdf'.
Please commit to reading chapters 1 through 20 before you reach the Javascript lessons.

This book should be your primary focus. However, secondarily we recommend

CSS Secrets by Lea Verou
